item.title: Abiogenesis
item.description: a set of humorous aphorisms that describe how communication often fails or leads to misunderstanding. They are named after Osmo Wiio, a Finnish professor and politician, who formulated them in 1978.

item.title: Campbell's Law
item.description: a social science principle that states that when a metric is used as a target or indicator of performance, it tends to lose its validity and distort the system it is supposed to measure.

item.title: Shirky's Principle
item.description: “Institutions will try to preserve the problem to which they are the solution.” — Clay Shirky
